question: We should address unemployment in Namibia by...

options.answer: Letting businesses create jobs without much government control.
Starting big public projects and sharing wealth.
Helping small businesses with better loans and lower taxes.
Investing in farming, factories, and roads.
Building one factory in each area to create jobs.

question: We should address the housing crisis by...

options.answer: Giving free land to low-income people.
Letting private companies find housing solutions.
Building affordable houses with government support.
Investing in cheap housing and improving informal settlements.
Working together with businesses to develop cities.

question: To improve healthcare in Namibia, we should...

options.answer: Keep the current system but make it work better and faster.
Provide free healthcare for everyone, focusing on those in need.
Build more hospitals, especially in rural areas.
Introduce healthcare for all (universal coverage).
Partner with private companies to improve healthcare.

question: To manage natural resources in Namibia, we should...

options.answer: Work with private companies to manage resources responsibly.
Take control of key resources like mines and land.
Ensure 50% of resources are processed in Namibia before being exported.
Let private companies manage our natural resources.
Share resources with disadvantaged communities.

question: To reduce corruption in Namibia, we should...

options.answer: Create special anti-corruption courts and stricter laws.
Strengthen existing anti-corruption agencies.
Support whistleblowers and make the government more transparent.
Reform public institutions and give more power to local authorities.
Make the Anti-Corruption Commission fully independent.
Letting businesses and charities address poverty without government involvement.
Starting government programs to create jobs and offer support.
Offering welfare programs and food aid.
Helping small businesses and informal traders grow.
Redistributing wealth and land for fairness.

question: To ensure food security, we should...

options.answer: Encourage private investment in farming and trade.
Promote eco-friendly farming practices.
Support small farmers and cooperatives.
Modernize agriculture and bring machines to rural areas.
Nationalize big farms so everyone has fair access to land.
Let private institutions handle education reform.
Modernize education with technology and focus on science subjects.
Link education better with job opportunities.
Offer free primary and secondary education, and job training.
Make higher education free and improve technical training in all regions.

question: To improve policing and justice, we should...

options.answer: Reform the courts and provide better police training.
Strengthen the police but improve oversight.
Give more power to local police for better accountability.
Start community policing and involve citizens in law enforcement.
Make the courts more transparent and ensure fair trials.

question: To manage land reform, we should...

options.answer: Encourage foreign investment in farming and land development.
Keep the current land policies with small changes.
Build housing and develop rural areas.
Redistribute land fairly to those who were disadvantaged in the past.
Support small farmers in owning land.
